website_summaries.verdict: The OCZ Vertex 4 is an excellent replacement drive for a standard-size laptop or desktop.
pros: The SATA 3 (6Gbps) 2.5-inch OCZ Vertex 4 is fast and affordable and comes with a tray adapter so it can also fit in a 3.5-inch drive bay
cons: The OCZ Vertex 4 isn't thin enough to be used in an ultrabook

customer_reviews.title: I absolutely love this SSD.
customer_reviews.text: I have been using this SSD for over a month now and absolutely love it. My speeds with it blow the doors off of what I used to have and I am only Sata 2 3gbps (EP45-DS3R mobo E8500 Core 2 Duo so not the best in class anymore). customer_reviews.author: Dark Alchemist

customer_reviews.title: Great performance
customer_reviews.text: I use this as my boot disk for a Linux Ubuntu 12.04 - executed a clean install from a downloaded ISO image and it worked just fine. I also keep a couple of other 'legacy' spinning magnetic disks (mounted on /var and /mnt/old-sys) and they work just fine. Boot time is really fast, around 50 seconds (down from almost 5 min with my old 7,200 magnetic disks) and apps seem to load very quickly: I have not done any benchmark, but this is an old system (circa 2005) with a dual-core AMD64 processor (yes, they still do exist) which I use mostly ad a development station and it works very well with this configuration. Recommended
customer_reviews.author: M. Massenzio

customer_reviews.title: OCZ has great support
customer_reviews.text: Had these for several years. I bought two and put them in a mirrored raid array for redundancy. I did have one fail recently and RMA'd it back to OCZ. This product was discontinued but they OCZ was awesome and replaced both of my drives with a newer model with better specs since I was uncomfortable with not having them match since they were being used as a pair. Would highly recommend OCZ products and their support
customer_reviews.author: M. Wiesen

customer_reviews.title: Great performance, not very reliable quality
customer_reviews.text: If you haven't upgraded your PC with an SSD, you must do it. Just leave a HDD for massive storage purposes and install the OS, software and games in the SSD. The performance gains are just amazing. UPDATE: Originally I gave this SSD 5 stars, however after 6 months of use this SSD suddenly stopped working, I tested it in other PCs without any results, is not being recognized even in the BIOS. You can google for many people with this sudden death cases. ( I just bought a new Samsung 840 Pro, top performance and they have better reliability in theory, no complains of suddent death from the users it seems.
customer_reviews.author: Andrés Arias

customer_reviews.title: Solid performance after 7 months
customer_reviews.text: Got 2 of these on a super sale. There's noticeably quieter operation than spindle drives. It handles load very well, like that nagging hang that a pc will get sometimes when it's doing something I/O ridiculous is non-existent. There's a very high quality when you hold them. Both are being used as primary OS drives (Laptop and Desktop). Installs like a regular spindle drive, doesn't need special disk drivers or installation procedures. I am happy having consistent Boot up and Shutdown times of less than 10 seconds. My setup: Asus Sabertooth Z87 4th gen Core i7 4770 Windows 8 Pro 8 GB DDR3 GTX 670 FTW SeaSonic Platinum SS-860XP2 860W
customer_reviews.author: Joseph A. Ramirez II

customer_reviews.title: 2012 MBP boots in 10.5 seconds.
customer_reviews.text: When I first purchased this I did a lot of research. The VERTEX was the only one that consistently worked across the board. For me, it has been flawless. Brought my 2012 MacBook Pro from a 45 seconds boot time to 10.5 seconds. No reason to purchase a new Mac when the CPU speeds have remained the same for a half decade. With this SSD, my 4 years old computer still provides a powerful, portable workstation for professional video editing. Hoping to upgrade from 256 to 512GB soon.
customer_reviews.author: Kai Staats

customer_reviews.title: Can't believe I waited this long to go SSD in my Macbook Pro
customer_reviews.text: I finally pulled the trigger and purchased the 256GB Vertex 4 and it absolutely screams in my 2011 Macbook Pro. I was worried by some of the other reviewers having issues with the Macbook Pros, but I learned over on the OCZ forum that the issue is is with external enclosures. So I popped the new drive in the internal drive bay and did a fresh install without a hitch. I'd read how installing an SSD is like getting a new computer, but I am still floored by how fast this thing runs. I can't believe I waited this long to go SSD. IMHO, the Vertex 4 is the best SSD value on the market right now. Highly recommended.
customer_reviews.author: Timothy Moose

customer_reviews.title: get some
customer_reviews.text: VERY fast/high performance SSD product. Went from three 7200rpm SATA drives (striped/RAID 0) to just this drive for the OS and software in my older computer (getting to about 5 years old now). Windows 7 boot time is now about 15-20 seconds (from when the system finishes it's pre-boot sequence). Application performance is also improved. I didn't use any cloning tools to set my system up with this drive. I find it's better to do a clean install when you've changed hardware, or even from time to time. Helps to ensure that no performance sucking crap gets pulled over to your newer, higher performance, hardware.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Rock Solid SSD
customer_reviews.text: I cloned my current drive to the OCZ Vertex 4 and it was so worth the money. I work in an enterprise environment and tested this drive out on my machine. I went from 5 minute boot times (mine is an admin machine with a database and other mgt software on it) to under 60 seconds from the time I hit the power button till the time it took for Outlook to open. I also saw a small improvement from changing from legacy setting in the BIOS to AHCI support. This also requires a registry change. Update: I have now installed 7 more of these drives in my users machines and they are very happy with the performance increase.
customer_reviews.author: Chey Harden

customer_reviews.title: Blazing Fast!
customer_reviews.text: Best SSD on the market which I managed to get at a fantastic price! I use this for my OS and Windows 7 boots up in about 5 seconds...Wow! I also have photoshop and GIMP 2.8 running from this but I will be using another 120G Vertex 4 solely for these and some video editing software,for quick loading. Just finished my new build..........Asrock Extreme 6 Z77 mobo Intel i7 3770K processor 16GB gskill Ripjaws Corsair 850W Gold Series PSU 2 EVGA Super clocked GTX 660 GPU cards in SLI Fractal Design Define R4 case-chasis Cooler Master Hyper 212 Pro CPU Heat Sink with blue LED CM fan
customer_reviews.author: Nick F.

customer_reviews.title: Best of the best
customer_reviews.text: I am very happy with this SSD, in this moment I have it with the firmware 1.5 in the following configuration Gigabyte Intel Z77 LGA1155 GA-Z77X-UD5H-WB WiFi Intel Core i5 3570K Processor 3.4 Thermaltake Water 2.0 PRO XFX AMD Radeon HD6870 Black Edition corsair vengeance 16gb And here the AS SSD Benchmark results: Read: 427,22 MB/s write: 351,29 MB/s ===================================================================================================== Estoy muy contento con este ssd, en esto momentos lo tengo con el firmware 1.5 en el las siguiente configuración Gigabyte Intel Z77 LGA1155 GA-Z77X-UD5H-WB WiFi Intel Core i5 3570K Processor 3.4 Thermaltake Water 2.0 PRO XFX AMD Radeon HD6870 Black Edition corsair vengeance 16gb Y aquí los resultados con AS SSD Benchmark Lectura: 427,22 MB/s Escritura: 351,29 MB/s
customer_reviews.author: Julio Cesar Romero Cuello

customer_reviews.title: Fortunately, OCZ's customer support was
customer_reviews.text: The drive is extremely fast and dramatically improves program load times, startup, and more. However, my drive did fail within a month of installation. Fortunately, OCZ's customer support was... decent, and I did receive a replacement (although my multiple attempts to contact OCZ in between the time I sent in the broken drive and when I received the new one were ignored). So far, I have had no issues with the new one. 3 stars is for the drive failure and the questionable customer support.
customer_reviews.author: Christopher M.

customer_reviews.title: Excellent SSD
customer_reviews.text: These drives are fast, and seem to be more reliable than Sandforce based drives. I have been using a 256GB Vertex 4 for about 4 months now and I have not had any problems. OCZ has been great with the firmware updates and stand behind their products. All of my Sandforce based SSD drives have eventually developed problems and started throwing BSOD's, I haven't had any issues like that with the Vertex 4 yet. The benchmarks on this drive are excellent, it's nearly on par with the Samsung 840 Pro series, and the prices are usually better.
customer_reviews.author: DesertDweller

customer_reviews.title: Makes my MacBook Pro MacBook Air Fast
customer_reviews.text: I had a Macbook Air which is great for traveling and messing around with around the house. I sold my iMac and really needed something bigger for school work. I opted for the older style 15" MacBook Pro for the built in ethernet, dvd drive and upgradeability over the Retina MacBooks. I dropped the OCZ SSD in my laptop and loaded up OSX. This drive works great and I treat my MacBook Pro just like an Air now. I never turn it off and when it does need a restart or wake up from sleep it's almost instant. Other plus side is I can upgrade this myself once prices come down.
customer_reviews.author: Fake Name

customer_reviews.title: Failed in less than a year - very disappointed
customer_reviews.text: Installed easily, bought a separate 3.5" to 2.5" adapter, but the SSD came with one, so I have an extra adapter now. I installed a new Windows 8 Pro 64-Bit (via DVD) on it, went without a hitch, and the whole install took less than 10 minutes. Haven't had a problem since. I recommend adjusting SSD settings like turning indexing off, just do a quick web search for SSD optimization and follow instructions. For those wondering, this SSD will boot from off in less than a minute, very nice. Highly recommended! October 2013 Update: Critical drive failure, no longer works at all, lost all data.
customer_reviews.author: Jason

customer_reviews.title: Makes my early 2011 15" Macbook Pro scream!
customer_reviews.text: I upgraded my early 2011 15" Macbook Pro from a 750GB standard hard drive to a 750GB hybrid drive thinking it would give the benefits of an SSD as advertised. While it was significantly faster than the stock 750GB, it wasn't until I upgraded to this 256GB Vertex 4 that things really improved. I often get sub-10 second boot times from the time I press power to the time my desktop is up, and by that point all of my apps that load at start are already up and waiting for it. I've never been more impressed with how much of a difference any single upgrade part has made on a computer!
customer_reviews.author: Aaron

customer_reviews.title: Absolutely Great
customer_reviews.text: Got at a reasonable price on Black Friday and the drive's performance is just more than satisfactory. OCZ really got it right this time, its better than the new TLC Samsung 840 and is cheaper. Also in reviews I noticed how speed drops very little as it gets filled up which is the big drawback of most SSDs ASSD Scores Initially: 2 Months later it scored a 1004 combined when more than 50% full!! Read: Write: Seq: 489.72 397.07 4K: 23.84 62.12 4K-64 302.39 307.34 Acc.: 0.142ms 0.034ms Score: 375 409 Total: 979
customer_reviews.author: Martin

customer_reviews.title: 5 Year Warranty
customer_reviews.text: Insanely fast, best upgrade path without buying an entirely new system. Scored a 7.9 on Win7 Index Rating (can't score any higher than that). Helps the most if your motherboard supports SATA 6.0 transfer speeds but even on older motherboards this SSD drive is blazing fast. Warranty of 5 years proves the manufacturer believes in their product. 128gigs is plenty of room to load an operating system and all your favorite programs, then use you old hard drive for storage. You won't worry or complain about speed again with this drive.
customer_reviews.author: Razzz

customer_reviews.title: Very, Very Fast
customer_reviews.text: So far, excellent drives. I bought two of them to run in RAID 0 on an Intel controller using Asus' Maximus V Extreme. RAID set up quickly and easily and works like a champ. Here are the benchmarks (run 3 times and averaged) for this setup. Benchmark program: AS SSD Benchmark Seq: Read 790 MB/s, Write 919.82 MB/s 4K: Read 24.14 MB/s, Write 63.75 MB/s 4k-64Thr:R 566 MB/s, Write 583 MB/s Access Time: Read .138 ms, Write .054 ms Total score: Read 670 Write 740 Total 1763 Very impressed with these drives.
customer_reviews.author: Jim Parshall

customer_reviews.title: Unmatchable!
customer_reviews.text: Recently I bought this disk to be install on Asus G75v-3d, as a main disk for operating system. Normally with the bundled HDD, took around 15-18 seconds for windows 7 to startup into windows logon, now is only took 9 seconds. Apart of that all the other common application that raise fast in a second like adobe acrobat, office suite, and not to talk about the launch of game is up in an blink. Update: I'm planning to buy a second disk, for make the configuration in RAID0, to reduce the latency to the double.
customer_reviews.author: Carlos A. Lara

customer_reviews.title: great for laptops
customer_reviews.text: I bought this for my media computer at home where it worked very well. I also bought one at work, which was a Vector 240gb. It's installed in a laptop. This is where I see the most benefit. I can take my laptop somewhere and it having it up and useable in under a minute. I hated waiting for startup programs to finish taking there toll on the hard drive before I could do something. I have installed an OCZ agility ssd, and I can tell this is much faster. Only downside is that the price is still a little high.
customer_reviews.author: Preston Rasberry

customer_reviews.title: Great Drive
customer_reviews.text: I installed this SSD as the C drive in my latest build, where only the operating system and programs are on this drive. All my personal files are on different drive. This drive has been working flawlessly for two months now. The boot speed on Windows 7 is so fast it is scary. Most applications just pop up in less than one second. Notoriously slow loading applications load in less than 10 seconds, e.g., Adobe After Effects and Photoshop both load in 8 seconds. The upgrading to an SSD C Drive will dramatically improve the performance of any computer not using an SSD.
customer_reviews.author: Tom Watson

customer_reviews.title: Still running strong since 2012
customer_reviews.text: I have this baby still in my Mac mini. I bought it to give my Mac mini a Fusion drive. Was definitely cheaper than buying a fusion from Apple. Looking back, it is almost 6 years old and still going strong. My Mac mini hasn't missed a beat. Great buy...
customer_reviews.author: Pj & Becky

customer_reviews.title: Awesome Deal
customer_reviews.text: This SSD is a steal for what I paid for it. Because of the storage capacity of the Vertex 4, this would cost around three hundred plus dollars in the US, but I paid $175. I loved the deal so much that I bought two and now my Macbook Pro is running like a beast because I replaced the original HDD and the optical drive with the two Vertex 4 SSD's. I also replaced the stock RAM with a 16GB (2x8GB) cards. This is a must have for people who use multimedia software such as Adobe Creative Suites (like myself), or Final Cut.
customer_reviews.author: Alex V

customer_reviews.title: Fast SSD
customer_reviews.text: Although the first one I received was bad, I am still giving this product 5 stars. Could have been damaged internally during shipping, who knows. From the packaging to the look and feel of the drive you can tell this is a SSD OCZ is proud of. The drive appears very well made and is very fast. Installation was simple with no issues. No special drivers were required for the motherboard to recognize the drive. I only wish I had a motherboard that could take full advantage of the Sata 6.0 GB/s. Even at the slower speeds it is that fastest drive I have ever owned. Would buy again.
customer_reviews.author: Cisco680

customer_reviews.title: Just as expected.
customer_reviews.text: Arrived early, well packaged, and the SSD firmware was upto date. The package included a metal frame with screws to fit into a standard PC drivebay: and the screws did fit. This SSD was used to replace an OCZ Agility 60GB. All in all, it took about 15 minutes to install and after cloning existing drive to the this new OCZ for a Win7 system, it came up without a hitch and and with a nice speed boost. Its makes for a good day when an order and purchase works out as advertised. Thank you Amazon. Thank you OCZ.
customer_reviews.author: A Taxpayer

customer_reviews.title: Four stars so far
customer_reviews.text: This drive was easy to install and is blazingly fast. I am reserving judgement on reliability until later due to a recent experience with another OCZ drive, so I will hold one star in reserve. This is the second OCZ SSD I have had. The first was an Agility 3 128 GB drive, and it lasted about 16 months before permanently crashing. OCZ replaced it under the warranty, but I couldn't wait for it to be traded out, plus I decided I needed a bigger drive, so I bought this 256 GB Vertex 4 to replace it. So far it has worked flawlessly for about 2 months.
customer_reviews.author: Lanier Dodson

customer_reviews.title: Amazing!
customer_reviews.text: I've been using a pair of these set up as Raid 0 32K stripe with Windows 7 Pro on a Dell XPS 8500 with I7 3.4 CPU and 12 gigs of ram. I also bought a MSATA to SATA adapter so that I could put them both on the only two 6gbs channels that exist on the motherboard. I took the other two 1TB drives and put them on the boards 3gbs channels for storage. Windows starts up warm within 7 seconds, 15 seconds from a cold start. I'll never go back to conventional drives again. Don't let the size fool you, 256 GB is plenty for the OS...the price is great too.
customer_reviews.author: Apache-=CW=-

customer_reviews.title: NaND controller burned - lost all data
customer_reviews.text: So after 6 months of use the ssd decided to malfunction and it would no longer boot up or get recognize, i send the drive to the preferred OCZ data recovery company and guess what! the kind of failure this drive had was one of the worse you could get, nand controller burned, so now i need to pay 3K $ (yes 3000 us $) to do an attempt of recover my data. Do not buy this drive! stay away! oh and by the way ocz will not refund the money they will give me a brand new drive that im planning to sell....
customer_reviews.author: Manuel

customer_reviews.title: Brought my old laptop back to life
customer_reviews.text: Now it boots way faster and seems to have more battery life. Drive is smaller than the original but I bought a small very inexpensive enclosure for that so now I used it as a USB drive. Works great! BTW, you can use the trial version of Acronis True Image to get your old drive data (including the little recovery partition) onto the new drive by performing a backup of the old drive and a restore onto the new drive. Otherwise the trial version has disabled all the useful copy/clone drive functions you need unless you pay for the full version. Didn't have to!
customer_reviews.author: William A. Henning

customer_reviews.title: Solid Performance
customer_reviews.text: I bought this to replace a standard HDD in my HP DV7 notebook that was dying. Installation was straight forward and once I finally was able to get Win7 installed everything went smoothly. Boot up time is amazing and most programs seem to see a bump in performance. Now when I get a Windows update and I need to reboot, it is no big deal. Boot-up from pushing the power button to sign-in screen takes about 11 seconds. Great drive, I only wish it had more space but for my use on the notebook it should be sufficient. A great deal for the price!
customer_reviews.author: Mark McLelland

customer_reviews.title: Failed after less than one week
customer_reviews.text: Title says it all. This SSD failed after only a week of use. I used this as an external drive in an enclosure to run Windows 8.1 off of via Boot Camp on my 2013 Mac Pro. It took 5 days before it was no longer seen by the Mac. Swapping out other SSDs showed the failure was the OCZ drive, which was dead. I've read that OCZ is out of business so buyer beware with regard to warranty. To Amazon's credit, free pickup via UPS and full refund - but only because mine died within the return period...
customer_reviews.author: C P

customer_reviews.title: Don't buy a new laptop
customer_reviews.text: My old dual-core laptop was making me crazy. It took forever to boot up and shut down. Earlier this year, I put a SSD in an older Asus netbook and was amazed at how it revitalized that little piece of equipment. So, instead of buying a new laptop, I bought this drive. WOW - it's like I have a new laptop. I dual-boot Windows 7 and Ubuntu 12.04, and the difference is phenomenal. Start up and shut down is very rapid. I feel like I have a new laptop! I'm glad I invested in this drive instead. I'd definitely buy again.
customer_reviews.author: The Professor

customer_reviews.title: Fast
customer_reviews.text: Working perfectly after several months. Upgraded from two Intel X25m G2 80GB SSDs. Everyday usage hasn't changed much but if you can push the drive, it will respond with serious throughput. A virus scan takes 1/4 of the time. Installs and upgrades are near instant. I'm running 24GB of memory and a 4.4 ghz quad core. Your mileage may vary. Update 7/9/15 after 2.5 years of usage. Drive is going strong with several terabytes written. AS-SSD still reports over 1000. The old OCZ toolbox is great for manually trimming the drive and viewing SMART data.
customer_reviews.author: Ochadd

customer_reviews.title: Wow
customer_reviews.text: Wow, just wow. I had an old Touchsmart Tablet PC I wanted to try with WinDoze 8. I figured the thing was too old and slow to work but I would find another home for the drive. I used SSDs a few years back and was not impressed - a lot of tweaking and fudging for a minor speed increase. Not the case here - the computer just flys. I an old core (not core2) processor and you can hardly tell. Very happy with this drive - I hope it holds up for the long term. Price was $79 on Amazon daily special for 128GB drive.
customer_reviews.author: Christopher Brown

customer_reviews.title: Great SSD for my laptop
customer_reviews.text: This SSD has been a great drive for me overall. I didnt see a drastic performance increase when I swapped it for my HDD but I bet I would see a world of difference if I went back! I occasionally get video stuttering, Im trying to figure out if its my NAS device, my network bandwidth or the drive. I dunno. Hard to diagnose. I get a buzz stuttering for about half a second and the video continues as usual. It only happens a few times. I notice it more when it is streaming from the network. Not sure if its not buffering enough or what...
customer_reviews.author: Gollum

customer_reviews.title: My SSD Is Faster than your HDD
customer_reviews.text: I've been lugging my OS around on an old Hitatchi 160GB drive for about 4 years now. I'd resigned myself to waiting several minutes or more to start up or shut down my PC. Installed two of these, one for Windows 7, and another specifically for Steam / Gaming. From boot to windows with no spinning icons in about 15-20 seconds, and from windows logo to windows in 5 flat. Shutdowns are instant. What else is there to say? Its bloody fast and a great price for the storage (picked up both when they were on sale for 70$)
customer_reviews.author: R. Kumar

customer_reviews.title: Redeemed
customer_reviews.text: I wrote a negative review before and I have to admit when I was wrong. Yes the drive died after a little more than a year. However, getting an RMA was as easy as going on their website, I sent them my dead drive and they sent me another one, it says it's refurbished so I hope it will last, but from I read here, SSD drives die a lot sooner than HDD's so just make sure to back up often and keep your fingers crossed.
customer_reviews.author: John Doe

customer_reviews.title: Lovin it!
customer_reviews.text: Not to much to say but it is faster and quieter than the old skool hard drives. Workings great running my XP SP3 windows. I have a modern PC and should be using Win 7 by now but XP still does everything I need and this SSD drive DOES work on XP without changing a thing. I got the 128Gb version. Partitioned it to 40Gb ( system ) other Gb's for programs etc.. Then I have a standard 650Gb drive for movies and backups til the prices come down for the larger SSD's. I think this is the best way right now.
customer_reviews.author: Mikey

customer_reviews.title: Solid SSD that is worth the money.
customer_reviews.text: It is quite fast, allows me to boot my desktop in less than 30 seconds compared to the 5 minutes from before, and this is with quite a lot of start-up programs combined with an old CPU. Im thinking that the bottleneck at this point is my CPU, as it is 2+ generations out of date now. you might want to figure out exactly how to properly install an SSD to get the most out of it before you purchase, as it took me quite a large amount of effort to properly configure everything so that it would work properly.
customer_reviews.author: Elc

customer_reviews.title: Turned a mid 2008 Macbook Pro into a ROCKET
customer_reviews.text: Have a mid 2008 Macbook Pro and was thinking about getting a new one until I started reading about the SSD's and how they were helping computers. My MBP used to take well over 1 minute to boot up and seemed like forever to open programs. I put the Vertex 4 256G in it yesterday. This thing works 5x faster than the fastest computer I've ever seen. Boot time is less than 20 seconds, opening programs are almost immediate... this thing is so much faster than any HDD coming out now it's not even close. Cannot recommend this Vertex 4 enough. Cost me $200 but a lot better than spending $2500 for less performance.
customer_reviews.author: Sandwah

customer_reviews.title: The Warranty is Not Honored by OCZ
customer_reviews.text: This SSD drive has failed twice, and I am unable to get OCZ Technology to honor the 5 year warranty. The drive will often just stop responding and then be back online in a few hours, usually with the data corrupt if it was writing data when it fails. It has been in several well ventilated, well powered desktop tower CPU cases, and has had the same failure mode of going offline and corrupting data.
customer_reviews.author: Book fan

customer_reviews.title: The Difference is Clear
customer_reviews.text: If you are having this solid state drive the difference is clear between it and any normal hard drive the speed on this one is really really fast and you can know that by giving it a try and the build quality is also great And the support is also great If you get a damaged one you can replace it, OCZ listens, well done OCZ
customer_reviews.author: meerdeer

customer_reviews.title: Soooo Fast!! Love it!!
customer_reviews.text: Best uprgade you can do for your PC. I have 16 GB ram and a this 256GB SSD, and this for sure qualifies as the fastest PC I've ever built. The 8 core CPU helps too. Could be a bit faster video, but I'll survive. Turned off the Win7 superfetch garbage and the swap file, Screamin!!! No need for a swap file when you have 16GB ram and a drive as fast as this one. Worth every penny. I've convinced the IT manager at work (my boss) to buy SSDs instead of spinning drives. Gonna be some happy users in the near future.
customer_reviews.author: T. Lucas

customer_reviews.title: awesome buy
customer_reviews.text: At first I was apprehensive about getting a ssd, I thought they were still too expensive and from what I'd seen with friends computers not that big of an upgrade. Well the upgrade for me was beyond noticeable. I boot now in like no time - something like 10 seconds, before it was about a min. I have my os and world of Warcraft on this and now my system just seems to fly through things. I totally recommend this ssd. It was very easy to install and its speed is blazing.
customer_reviews.author: mikenphx34

customer_reviews.title: Fantastic Speeds!
customer_reviews.text: As a gamer, the most important things to me in looking for a drive are affordability and speed. The size, while a bit small, still holds 6 large (10+GB) games, and the OS (Windows 7 Ultimate 64bit). The speeds in which this SSD will boot is breathtaking. 15 seconds from the time I press the power button until your system is usable and a 10 second shut down! Games load instantly. The SSD itself comes with a bracket, but most new cases support these 2.5" drives, too.
customer_reviews.author: C. Patterson

customer_reviews.title: hits the sweet spot
customer_reviews.text: i got this brand SSD because it hit the Sweet spot for each aspect of judge a SSD on( speed, reliability, and price) this was 219$ when i got it, it has 256 gigs (less then the original HDD in my Macbook but plenty of space for me) and it is much faster then others in its price range. on a disk speed test with black magic i got 476 MB/s write speeds and 456MB/s on the read speeds. so this thing moves!...... i am thinking of saving up and getting a second SSD for the optical bay and doing a fusion drive but we will see.
customer_reviews.author: christopher scandrick

customer_reviews.title: Buy it, ridiculously good.
customer_reviews.text: I wasn't quite sure about this product before purchasing it. I had read multiple reviews about OCZ and the Vertex 4 edition that were all positive. I didn't think this product would live up to the hype so I bought this 256 version to replace my raid 0 WD Raptor drives. Went from a 5.9 to a 6.9 in the windows index experience. The transfer rate is almost instant when moving from disc to disc, it really is incredible. I am never buying a HDD again and will be purchasing two more of these SDDs in the 512 version and will be raid 0 ing them. This product is worth every penny.
customer_reviews.author: Brandon

customer_reviews.title: Fast, reliable drive.

product_meta.description:
Size:256 GBOCZ Technology 256GB Vertex 4 Series SATA 6.0 GB/s 2.5-Inch Solid State Drive (SSD) With Industry's Highest 120K IOPS And 5-Year Warranty - VTX4-25SAT3-256G

AMAZON.COM



As the fourth generation of the legendary Vertex SSD family, the Vertex 4 Series pushes storage performance to the max and redefines the modern day computing experience. Vertex 4 SSDs are innovatively engineered to deliver industry-leading file transfer rates and superior system responsiveness, all while providing a more durable, reliable, and energy efficient storage solution compared to traditional hard drives. 



The OCZ Vertex 4 2.5-inch SSD (view larger).

Designed to take full advantage of the SATA III interface, the Vertex 4 unleashes ultimate productivity, gaming, and multimedia applications. This model of the 2.5-inch Vertex 4 SSD (VTX4-25SAT3-256G) offers 256 GB of storage capacity, a 510 MB/s maximum sequential write speed, and 120,000 IOPS maximum I/O performance. It's backed by a 5-year limited warranty.

EXCELLING IN PERFORMANCE, NO MATTER THE FILE TYPE
Mirroring real-world performance scenarios over a broad spectrum of consumer desktop and mobile applications, Vertex 4 SSDs are designed to provide a superior user experience and extreme performance over the other current solutions available on the market.

With the cutting-edge Indilinx Everest 2 platform, Vertex 4 is optimized for consistently high speeds with the complete spectrum of file types and sizes including both compressible and incompressible data for balanced performance like no other drive you've experienced.





KEY FEATURES
INDUSTRY'S HIGHEST IOPS 
You'll get incredible performance in workstation and heavy-duty environments with multiple data threads and performance up to 120,000 IOPS (Input/Output Operations Per Second, pronounced eye-ops).




NO COMPRESSION-RELATED PERFORMANCE LIMITATIONS
Better performance with "real world" data streams of varying "compressibility" as well as fully incompressible data such as videos and multimedia files, encrypted data, archive files such as .ZIP files, and software.




INDILINX INFUSED EVEREST 2 PLATFORM
Its leading-edge, dual-ARM controller architecture enables faster performance like nothing else you've experienced.




FAST BOOT TIMES AND ULTRA-LOW LATENCY
Boot up in as little as 9 seconds, and industry-low latencies of .04 reads and .02 writes enable superior multitasking and flawless performance.




NDURANCE 2.0 TECHNOLOGY
Advanced suite of NAND Flash management to increase durability and reliability to expand the NAND's lifespan.




INDUSTRY-LEADING WARRANTY
Limited 5 year warranty backed by OCZ's renowned service (with toll-free tech support and 24-hour online forum support) for ultimate peace of mind.



MORE SPECIFICATIONS


Designed with a superior user experience 
and extreme performance (view larger).

RELIABILITY/PROTECTION
 * Mean Time Between Failures (MTBF): 2 million hours 
 * Data Path Protection: ECC corrects up to 128 random bits/1KB 
 * Data Encryption: 256-bit AES-compliant, ATA Security Mode Features 
 * Product Health Monitoring: Self-Monitoring, Analysis and Reporting Technology (SMART) Support 

COMPATIBILITY
 * Serial ATA (SATA): Fully compliant with Serial ATA International Organization (Serial ATA Revision 3.0) and ATA/ATAPI-8 Standard Native Command Queuing (NCQ) 
 * Operating System: Windows XP 32-bit /64-bit; Windows Vista 32-bit / 64-bit; Windows 7 32-bit / 64-bit; Linux; Mac OS X 

ADDITIONAL FEATURES
 * Performance Optimization: TRIM (requires OS support), dynamic and static wear-leveling, background garbage collection, Indilinx nDurance 2.0 Technology to extend SSD lifespan 
 * Other Performance Features: Ndurance 2.0 Technology (reduced write amplification without compression, advanced multi-level ECC, adaptive NAND flash management) 
 * Service & Support: 5-year warranty, toll-free tech support, 24 hour forum support 

THE SSD ADVANTAGE
Whether you're refreshing an older laptop or trying to maximize the potential of the latest platform, SSDs provide substantial benefits over traditional hard drives.



GREATER DURABILITY
Solid State Drives feature a non-mechanical design of NAND flash mounted to circuit boards, shock resistant up to 1500g. Hard disk drives consist of various moving parts making them susceptible to shock and damage.

FASTER PERFORMANCE
SSDs have 100 times greater throughput and instantaneous access times for quicker boot-ups, faster file transfers, and overall snappier performance than hard drives. HDDs can only access the data faster the closer it is from the read/ write heads, while all parts of the SSD can be accessed at once.

LESS POWER CONSUMPTION, SILENT OPERATION, AND LIGHTWEIGHT

With no moving parts, SSDs run virtually silent in your notebook or PC case to eliminate distracting noises during gaming or entertainment. And SSDs won't weigh down your laptop, netbook, or tablet PC when you're on the go.
